alert.note: Alert for Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 8:58AM CDT until August 05 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Paducah KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. .Excessive rainfall in and near the Skillet Fork River basin will cause a sharp rise in the river level at Wayne City. It is forecast to go above flood stage Friday morning, and rise to a crest near 15.8 feet Friday evening. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skillet Fork River at Wayne City. * WHEN...From Friday morning to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding occurs affecting mainly bottomland and surrounding low lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
